VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the Date (and time) by which the clinician will reference the document. For Progress Notes, this will likely be the date of the provider's encounter with the patient. For Discharge Summaries, it will correspond to the Discharge Date of the Admission referenced in the document. (If there is no Discharge Date when dictated, it will correspond to the dictation date of the record instead.)In all cases, this is the date by which the document will be referencedand sorted.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: see discussion

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the date/time at which the document was originally entered intothe database.
This is the person who composed or dictated the document.

name is proper to provider
sig is specific to instance, hence provenance.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the date/time at which cosignature was obtained.

A' FOR ambulatory; -> class = ambulatory 'H' FOR hospitalization; -> class = inpatient 'I' FOR in hospital; -> class = daytime 'T' FOR telecommunications; -> class = virtual 'E' FOR event (historical); -> class = other

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the location (WARD or CLINIC) associated with the document.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: VistA: "This is the location (WARD or CLINIC) associated with the document."

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the location at which the visit/admission occurred. As distinct from the HOSPITAL LOCATION field, which represents the location at the time the document was written, this is the location for the visit/admission with which the note is associated.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: This is the location at which the visit/admission occurred. As distinct from the HOSPITAL LOCATION field, which represents the location at the time the document was written, this is the location for the visit/admission with which the note is associated.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field contains the institution associated with the document. It is extracted from the document's hospital location if known; otherwise it is extracted from the user's log-on division.

VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: pointer: .01 is date/time context.period already used at 0.07

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the mode by which the signature was obtained (i.e., eitherelectronic or chart).
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: E' FOR electronic; 'C' FOR chart;

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This boolean flag indicates to the system whether or not a cosignature isneeded.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: 1' FOR YES; '0' FOR NO;

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Applies to ID (interdisciplinary) notes only. The ID PARENT is the notethis note is attached to, making this note an entry in an ID note. A note with an ID PARENT is referred to as an ID child note. ID parentnotes and ID child notes are both file entries in file 8925. The entries of an interdisciplinary note consist of the first entry, whichis also the ID PARENT of the ID note, followed by the ID children.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: pointer to file

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the date/time at which the treatment episode associated with thisdocument was initiated (e.g., Amission date/time for a discharge summary,Visit date/time for a clinic note, Transfer date/time for an interimsummary). Time is optional.
This is the ending date/time for the treatment episode associated withthis document (e.g., . Time is optional.

This is the date (and time) on which the document was dictated by its author. In the event that a document originates by dictation, we recommend that the REFERENCE DATE for the document be defaulted to dictation date, as the author will be able to identify the document by the date on which s/he dictated it.
This field allows a linkage to be maintained between the TIU Document andthe DHCP Package for which it was generated.
VistA_FHIR_Map.priorityNote: In SDA, Referrals and Procedures hold Document#'s
don't think we need this/Lina B.
don't think we need this/Lina B.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the "TO" service/specialty. This service is responsible forcompletion of the consult/request.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: pointer to service 123.5. recipient is 0..*

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field represents the location that sent the order to the receiving location.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: pointer to location 44

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the procedure that was requested via CPRS while ordering.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: pointer to protocol 101 or procedure 123.3; retrieve name .01 "Enter the type of procedure being requested (e.g., EKG, UGI, etc.)." align with R4 serviceRequest.category

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field will indicate whether the order is a consult or procedurerequest order. Based on this fields value, the Consultation Body Headeralters to indicate "Consult Type: " or "Procedure Request: ".
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: C' FOR Consult; 'P' FOR Procedure;
pointer to location 44

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the provider who originated the order.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: pointer to person 200

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field describes the urgency of the consult. Urgencies are sent in thePROTOCOL File (#101) as: STAT, EMERGENCY, INPATIENT, NEXT AVAILABLE, NOW,ROUTINE, TODAY, WITHIN 24 HOURS, WITHIN 48 HOURS, WITHIN 72 HOURS,WITHIN 1 WEEK, WITHIN 1 MONTH.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Pointer to protocol 101 STAT, EMERGENCY, INPATIENT, NEXT AVAILABLE, NOW, ROUTINE, TODAY, WITHIN 24 HOURS, WITHIN 48 HOURS, WITHIN 72 HOURS, WITHIN 1 WEEK, WITHIN 1 MONTH
date requested by consult requestor

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Enter the name of a person you would like to alert about the consult.This person will be sent a notification that a new consult exists.In order for the person to see this type of notification, the personmust be set up to receive "New service consult" notifications.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: pointer to person 200; the consult requestee

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the date and time the order was released from OE/RR.If the TO service entered the order stub through the Add Order (AD)action, this is the service-specified request date.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: date/time this order was released from CPRS
pointer to institution 4; cardinality means this is an extension
name of institution
institution station number

VistA_FHIR_Map.Data_x0020_Elements: Patient will be seen as IP or OP
VistA_FHIR_Map.Field_x0020_Name: SERVICE RENDERED AS IN OR OUT
VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field allows the ordering person to indicate if the service is tobe rendered on an outpatient or inpatient basis. This is to alleviatethe confusion if patient is currently an inpatient/outpatient but isjust about to be discharged/admitted and become a outpatient/inpatient.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: I' FOR inpatient; 'O' FOR outpatient;

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the place where the consultation will take place. Choose from: B - Bedside C - Consultant's Choice E - Emergency Room O - On Call EKG - EKG Lab

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field is used to store the coded portion of the Provisional Diagnosisif a coded diagnosis is sent via CPRS.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the date of the provisional diagnosis and will contain a value ifthe request is filed with a coded diagnosis. This field is usedinternally to help identify if a given code is active.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Is this from somewhere else, or written in the consult request?

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the 3-character Source Abbreviation (SAB) for the coding system to which a given diagnosis code belongs. This field will only contain a value when a given service is configured to receive a coded diagnosis. This field is used internally to check if a given code is active. For example, ICD is stored if the coding system is ICD-9. 10D is stored ifthe coding system is ICD-10.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: abbreviation for code system

VistA_FHIR_Map.priorityNote: Patient not stored as a property

VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: This is the date (to the second) the ordered [sic] was entered.

This is the pointer value of the corresponding entry in the Orders file (100) when the order is entered through the OE/RR process. Do we need two systems for two identifiers: an OERR identifier & a Pharmacy identifier?
Medication to be taken If we need the medication resource, Binding: Medication Clinical Drug (RxNorm) (extensible)
Parsed by VistA into 120, ,121
This is the numeric dosage for the order. It will be combined with the UNIT field to show the dosage ordered. For a dosage of 325MG, 325 would be stored here.
Use UCUM where possible. Get values; leverage KBS UCUM map.

Conceivably supportable with expectedSupplyDuration/ maxDosePerPeriod/ numberOfRepeatsAllowed, or do we need an extension - but too sketchy. Make it an extension.
This is the length of time to administer, or the total volume to administer, for IV fluid
Yes; composite relationship to Parent. Direction in question: document parent or child, or both?
Don't use the MedicationOrder.dispenseRequest.validityPeriod: this is the wrong data type.

Unusual object model. "Unit" not defined. This is the number of UNITS (tablets, capsules, etc.) to be dispensed as a DOSE for this order. The literals '1/2' and '1/4' may be entered. If there is no entry, it is assumed to be ONE (1).

This is the frequency (ONLY) with which the doses are to be administered. Several forms of entry are acceptable, such as Q6H, 09-12-15, STAT, QOD, and MO-WE-FR@AD (where MO-WE-FR are days of the week, and AD is the admin times). Thinigs not coded migh
This is the date and time the order is to begin. "Enter the date and time that the first dose is to be given."
This is the date and time the order will automatically expire. This package initially assigns a default STOP DATE/TIME, depending on the SITE PARAMETERS.
This is the set of administration times for this order.
This is the Date/Time the provider is requesting that this order start.
This is the user who entered the order.

The rate at which the IV is to be administered. This value, together with the total volume of the hyperal or the admixture type, is used to determine the time covered by one bag; hence the system can predict the bags needed during a specified time of coverage. This field is free text for IVPB's. For LVP's you must enter a number representing the infusion rate. You may also specify the # of bags per day needed, which will become the default number of LABELS PER DAY.
VistA_FHIR_Map.Extension: if number, dosageInstruction.rate[x] (?) also/otherwise, extension: infusion

VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: IV room where IV bag was prepared for administration.
The number of IV labels needed each day. If populated, this value will override the system-calculated number of labels.
The additive selected as part of the IV order. This entry is a pointer to the ADDITIVES file (52.6).

"STRENGTH" is the amount of an additive to be used in the manufacturing of the IV order. NOTE! You will be expected to use the strength units that were previously defined within the IV ADDITIVE file (52.6) for each additive.

This is the bottle number (or numbers, separated by commas) in which this additive will be included for this IV order. If this field is blank, it means that the additive will be included in all bottles.
Enter the name of the clinic where the patient was seen. Entry must be a clinic. Depending on the condition, INACTIVATE and REACTIVATE dates may exist.

HELP-PROMPT: Date and time of the appointment for this clinic location. DESCRIPTION: This is the date and time of the appointment this order is being placed for. May be encounter at which order is created or for which created.
The solution entered as part of the specified IV order.
The volume of this solution in MLs. Only numeric values may be entered in this field. The total volume of the IV order is sum of solution's volumes.
This field will contain the narrative portion of the OBX segment sent from OE/RR when an order check occurs.
This field will contain the name of the provider who over-rode the order check. It comes as a part of the OBX segment from OE/RR.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This reflects the current condition of this entry, whether transcribedby a clerk from the paper chart, entered or verified by a provider,or marked as removed from the patient's list.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If the patient has service connection on file in the DHCP Patient file #2,this problem specifically may be flagged as being service connected.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: If this problem is related to a patient's service in the Persian Gulf,it may be flagged here.

If this problem is related to the treatment of military sexual trauma, it maybe flagged here.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the service primarily involved in the treatment of this problem;the DHCP Problem List defaults this field to the service defined inFile #200 for the Recording Provider of this problem, upon entry of theproblem. It may later be used to categorize problems for screening andsorting.
This is the date this problem was originally recorded, either online orin the paper chart; it may be the same as, or earlier than, the DateEntered.

Enter one of following set of codes: H for hold, D for Discontinue, U for Unhold, E for Edit, R for Renew, I for Reinstate, AI for auto reinstate, O for On Call, C for Off call, V for Verify, F for Complete, PNRD for Pending/Non-Verified Renewal Discontinued, G for Flagged, or UG for Unflagged.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field is used to show the status of the patient at the time the medication was filled.

Clinic where treatment was given and prescription was written.
The actual medication.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: what data

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Free Text that, if it exists, will replace the DRUG name on the RXlabel.
This field is used to show the amount of medication that was dispensed.
Enter a whole number between 1 and 90. The maximum upper limit is 90,but may be lower based on the maximum specified for this patient status.This parameter is defined in the RX PATIENT STATUS file.
The number of refills allowed per prescription.
The number of copies made of the label for the prescription.
Indicates if the medication will be picked up or mailed to the patient.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: coordinate with 55-.03

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Any additional comments.
This field will show who requested the rx.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Date when doctor wrote prescription.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: "Can be edited to manage expiry? Keep 'issuedate' nmae"

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: The date the prescription was entered.
The date the prescription was filled.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: finish or hand over?

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field is used to identify the pharmacist that filled the medicationrequest.
The date the medication expires. This is required to be puton the labels of medication sent to a nursing home.
This field is used to show the actual date and time the medication wasreleased for inventory purposes and copay billing if applicable.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: disambiguate release, fill, dispense

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field indicates whether or not the patient received counselingabout the prescription.
This field indicates whether or not the patient understood the counselingon the prescription, if the patient was counseled.
Tells which Outpatient Pharmacy Division filledthe prescription.
This field is used to show when and if the medication was returned to stockbecause the patient did not pick up the meds or it was not mailed.
This field identifies the cosigning physician for prescriptions written bya provider for whom a counter signature is required, for example a nursepractitioner.
This field contains the last fill date.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: for renewal only?

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field is used to show the pharmacist that verified the prescription

The text in this field shall be used for the Patient Instructions in theOutpatient Pharmacy package when entering orders, if the Dispense Drugselected is matched to a Pharmacy Orderable Item with patient instructions.
Enter any special instructions that should appear on mailing addressportion of the label, specifing where, or when the RX(s) should be picked up.

During Outpatient Pharmacy order entry, a pharmacist may be asked if themedication being prescribed is for a service connected condition. Thisfield will store the pharmacist's response to this question. The value inthis field will be used to evaluate whether or not a copay should beapplied to the prescription. This value will also be used as a defaultshould this question be raised again during the life of the prescriptionwhen a prescription fill is being released, or as the default for thequestion upon renewal of the prescription through CPRS or OutpatientPharmacy.

VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: This is a single dose of medication the patient will receive for this Rx order. Unclear
For conjunct sigs, each doseageInstruction also requires a serial number to allow the batch to be parsed in order.

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field stores any provider comments that are passed to Pharmacy fromCPRS.
This field is used to distinguish what type of external discontinueaction occurred.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: 1' FOR HOSPITAL ADMISSION; '2' FOR EDITED BY PROVIDER;

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the Pharmacy Orderable Item associated with the drug.This data should not be entered by using File Manager. If the Rx does nothave a Pharmacy Orderable Item entered check the drug for the RX. If thedrug is missing an orderable item match the drug not the Rx. Only matchingthe Rx will cause problems when renewing the Rx.
This is the CPRS entry number for this order.
This field is used to indicate the person who finished the order in Pharmacy.
Date/time prescription is finished.
The name of the pharmacist who scanned the barcode before filling themedication request.
The name of the pharmacist that checked the medication request.

VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Expanded, readable format of 52.0113 information

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This field represents the current status of the prescription.
This field contains the internal entry number of the pointer to theIB Action Type file (#350.1).
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: RR - Need this for '$' indicator

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the Titration Dose Rx from which the corresponding Maintenance Dose Rx originated.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Needed to determine the Titrationm indictor (TITRX^PSOUTL)

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This is the Maintenance Dose Rx that was created from the corresponding Titration Dose Rx.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Needed to determine the Titrationm indictor (TITRX^PSOUTL)

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This flag indicates whether the prescription is being dispensed as a Titration Dose. It is intended to identify a Titration Dose Rx without a corresponding Maintenance Dose Rx.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Needed to determine the Titrationm indictor (TITRX^PSOUTL)

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: This date is used to indicate when the medication was cancelled.
VistA_FHIR_Map.FHIR_x0020_Map_x0020_Comment: Needed to determine recently disontinued and expired list

VistA_FHIR_Map.description: Dispensed As Written code. This information is used for electronic claim transmission to third party payers (insurance companies).

During Outpatient Pharmacy order entry, if a veteran has been identifiedas having been treated for Military Sexual Trauma, the pharmacist may beasked to identify whether or not the medication prescribed is being usedto treat a condition related to Military Sexual Trauma. This field willstore the pharmacist's response to this question. The value in this fieldwill be used to evaluate whether or not a copay should be applied to theprescription. This value will also be used as a default should thisquestion be raised again during the life of the prescription when aprescription fill is being released, or as the default for the questionupon renewal of the prescription through CPRS or Outpatient Pharmacy.

During Outpatient Pharmacy order entry, if a veteran has been identifiedas having been exposed to Agent Orange during Vietnam service, thepharmacist may be asked to identify whether or not the medicationprescribed is being used to treat a condition due to this exposure. Thisfield will store the pharmacist's response to this question. The value inthis field will be used to evaluate whether or not a copay should beapplied to the prescription. This value will also be used as a defaultshould this question be raised again during the life of the prescriptionwhen a prescription fill is being released, or as the default for thequestion upon renewal of the prescription through CPRS or OutpatientPharmacy.

During Outpatient Pharmacy order entry, if a veteran has been identifiedas having been exposed to ionizing radiation during military service, thepharmacist may be asked to identify whether or not the medicationprescribed is being used to treat a condition due to this exposure. Thisfield will store the pharmacist's response to this question. The value inthis field will be used to evaluate whether or not a copay should beapplied to the prescription. This value will also be used as a defaultshould this question be raised again during the life of the prescriptionwhen a prescription fill is being released, or as the default for thequestion upon renewal of the prescription through CPRS or OutpatientPharmacy.

During Outpatient Pharmacy order entry, if a veteran has been identifiedas having been exposed to Southwest Asia Conditions (formerly referred toas Environmental Contaminants), the pharmacist may be asked to identifywhether or not the medication prescribed is being used to treat acondition due to this exposure. This field will store the pharmacist'sresponse to this question. The value in this field will be used toevaluate whether or not a copay should be applied to the prescription.This value will also be used as a default should this question be raisedagain during the life of the prescription when a prescription fill isbeing released, or as the default for the question upon renewal of theprescription through CPRS or Outpatient Pharmacy.

During Outpatient Pharmacy order entry, if a veteran has been identifiedas having been treated for Head and/or Neck Cancer due to nose or throatradium treatments while in the military, the pharmacist may be asked toidentify whether or not the medication prescribed is being used to treatthis condition. This field will store the pharmacist's response to thisquestion. The value in this field will be used to evaluate whether or nota copay should be applied to the prescription. This value will also beused as a default should this question be raised again during the life ofthe prescription when a prescription fill is being released, or as thedefault for the question upon renewal of the prescription through CPRS orOutpatient Pharmacy.

During Outpatient Pharmacy order entry, a pharmacist may be asked if the medication being prescribed is for a condition related to Combat Services while in the military. This field will store the pharmacist's response tothis question. The value in this field will be used to evaluate whether ornot a copay should be applied to the prescription. This value will also beused as a default should this question be raised again during the life ofthe prescription.

During Outpatient Pharmacy order entry, a pharmacist may be asked if themedication being prescribed is for a condition related to PROJ 112/SHADwhile in the military. This field will store the pharmacist's response tothis question. The value in this field will be used to evaluate whether ornot a copay should be applied to the prescription. This value will also beused as a default should this question be raised again during the life ofthe prescription.
This field indicates the number of days a discontinued or expired med orderappears in reverse video on a patient's med profile.
